intro: Conostephium wonganense, commonly known as Wongan bush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
